etymology.interpretation: Combines the morpheme for medicine with a suffix meaning scholar/person to mean a medical practitioner. In compounds like 先生 or 儒生, 生 marks a learned person, so here it denotes one who practices healing.
etymology.simplification: 醫 was simplified to 医 by removing the 酉 component and streamlining strokes; 生 stayed the same. The change reduces stroke count for a very high‑frequency character.

parts.english: to be born; life; raw; student

examples.chinese: 他想当医生(他想當醫生)。
examples.english: He wants to be a doctor.

examples.chinese: 医生给我开了药(醫生給我開了藥)，让我按时服用(讓我按時服用)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng gěi wǒ kāi le yào, ràng wǒ ànshí fúyòng.
examples.english: The doctor prescribed me medicine and told me to take it on time.

examples.chinese: 遇到紧急情况(遇到緊急情況)，请立刻联系医生(請立刻聯繫醫生)。
examples.pinyin: Yùdào jǐnjí qíngkuàng, qǐng lìkè liánxì yīshēng.
examples.english: In an emergency, please contact a doctor immediately.
